result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerrianne M Paulson

defendant.name: Paulson, Kerrianne M

records.addlTxt: 10/31/22 Atty. Ocwieja ltr. RE: rescheduling 10/31 matter

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Rescheduled
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
The SPD Office advises that they have not been able to find an attorney for Ms. Paulson's hearing of 10/12/22.  They will continue to look for representation.

9:55 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson in court.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Kerrianne M Paulson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF11, 22CF112, 22CF124, 22CF135

9:57 AM Breakout room 
10:08 AM Court resumes. 


22CF135 Initial Appearance; Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

22CF111 & 22CF124 Preliminary Hearing

1W - Officer Wallin, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Attorney Steiner sent in 22CF124 incident report to Attorney Wynes for review. 
Exhibit #1 Incident Report -  M, O, R 
Cross by Attorney Wynes

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Attorney Wynes waives argument and objects to bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Wynes requests another day for an arraignment for 22CF111 & 22CF124

22CF112 and 22CF135 will be set for Status Hearings.
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:28 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State recommends a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed for the defendant.  Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and, if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to a blood draw.
